snippet: The package would delay a planned tax on high-cost health insurance plans, suspend a tax on medical devices and expand aid for 9/11 responders.
abstract: House Republicans and Democrats, approaching midnight deadline, reach agreement on $1.1 trillion omnibus spending bill and large package of tax breaks; lawmakers report approved package will  include reauthorization and expansion of James Zagroda 9-11 Health and Compensation Act, providing aid for Sept 11 first responders suffering from diseases related to terrorist attacks.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ROBERT PEAR

lead_paragraph: The package would delay a planned tax on high-cost health insurance plans, suspend a tax on medical devices and expand aid for 9/11 responders.

headline.main: House Reaches Accord on Spending and Tax Cuts
headline.print_headline: Parties Reach House Deal on Spending and Tax Breaks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: James Zadroga 9-11 Health and Compensation Act
